def planner_request.get_state.Staterobot.get_gps_data (   self)

API function to read the GPS data of Spiri.

This function gives the latitude, longitude, altitude reported by the GPS Data can be accessed using obj.latitude, obj.longitude, obj.altitude

Definition at line 173 of file get_state.py.

def planner_request.get_state.Staterobot.get_gps_vel (   self)

API function to read the GPS velocity of Spiri.

This function gives the velocity reported by the GPS. Data can be accessed using obj.x, obj.y, obj.z

Definition at line 163 of file get_state.py.

def planner_request.get_state.Staterobot.get_orientation (   self,
  format = 0 
)

API function to read the orientation of Spiri This function gives the orientation by fusing data from IMU, GPS and other sensors.

Returns an object. Depending upon the format Euler - Orientation can be accessed using obj.x,obj.y,obj.z Quaternion - obj.x,obj.y,obj.z,obj.w

Parameters:
format1=Quaternion, 0=Euler

Definition at line 114 of file get_state.py.

def planner_request.get_state.Staterobot.get_orientation_imu (   self,
  format = 'euler' 
)

API function to read the orientation of Spiri.

This function gives the orientation reported by the IMU Depending upon the format Euler - Orientation can be accessed using obj.x,obj.y,obj.z Quaternion - obj.x,obj.y,obj.z,obj.w

Returns:
object
Parameters:
formateuler=Euler quat=Quaternion

def planner_request.get_state.Staterobot.send_goal (   self,
  x,
  y,
  z 
)

API function to send goals to Spiri.

This function will send a goal with respect to the world. The start position of Spiri is 0,0

Todo:

Return based something on success or failure

This function should also take in GPS coordinates

Parameters:
xcoordinate in x axis
ycoordinate in y axis
zcoordinate in z axis

Definition at line 196 of file get_state.py.

def planner_request.get_state.Staterobot.send_goal_relative (   self,
  x,
  y,
  z 
)

API function to send goals to Spiri.

This function will send a goal with respect to the start position. Example-: Suppose Spiri is at 1,1,1 and we call this function send_gaol_relative(1,0,0). Spiri will move 1 m in x direction.

Todo:
Return based something on success or failure
Parameters:
xdistance in metres in x axis
ydistance in metres in y axis
zdistance in metres in z axis
